History: Course- Episodic; Present history: Patient's current complaints have been present from past few months with beliefs that the government has been kidnapping girls for sex trafficking and prostitution. Patient tried calling the police but later established that the police is also involved in this. Patient's sleep has been disturbed as he gets worried due to this situation; Past history: hospitalisation due to a similar episode in the past.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behaviour: Cooperative, rapport established; Speech: Productivity: Increased; Thought- Content: false, unshakeable beliefs; Insight: Grade 1
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient discussed about his/her belief that government has been involved in kidnapping and sex trafficking and that he/she is being misunderstood for being depressed by his/her father. Patient did not have insight of his/her current state.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established. It was strengthened when the patient disclosed about his/her acting along with other people when it came to trusting them. Patient had a strong conviction about his/her beliefs beliefs and it was observed that he/she did not have any insight of it. He/she was not receptive of therapy and believed that it would be better if his/her father would take it.
